There are many types of crabs. I would prefer to see 3 to 5 types of them. Regardless of their color when alive, all crabs should be red upon cooked.

coconut crabs  Orange & Red or Black & blue - They come in two sizes, depending on their diet. While growing up, if fed on enough coconuts they grow to the larger size. sometimes seen on the side of coconut trees.

King crab (red & white) - Crabs with very long legs.

Typical Hermit Crab (red) - as they grow they look for bigger shells to occupy.

Blue crab   (blue legs, green shell, red tipped claws) - a Delicious sweet crab

Typical red crab (red) -  same size as the blue crab

This is not a good idea, it would ruin the pattern of the current ores. We have basic ores that everyone knows of, like copper, iron, gold, amethest, diamond, emerald, redstone, lapis lazuli, etc. All of these ores with the acceptance of Redstone are common and well known, Redstone gets a pass because its name is simple and combines two existing English words. Adding "Sakura crystal" wouldn't fit with the others and its name doesn't tip off the players on what it even is (unless you're fluent in Japanese). Other than customization there wouldn't be anything to craft with it, and finding an item to with it would be difficult because this ore isn't used for anything in real life either. Also, I'm assuming this is Japanese, so in Japan what would they call it? If it wasn't changed, for Japanese players it would be just "Cherry blossom crystal". In my opinion, it would be better if it was called "Pink Stone" rather than "Sakura ore", or something like rose quartz like someone else suggested.

Needless to say, we need an "official" ability to lie down and crawl. It's so frustrating to carry a sunroof or a bucket of water with you just to lie down, although it would seem that lying down is much easier than just standing. This will improve the gameplay, just imagine, we can easily climb into a window opening or into a narrow cave, hide without breaking blocks.
It would be fair if digging, cutting wood while lying down would be slower.

There is no pure iron in silverfish.
Instead, silverfish could shed chitin needed for new armor.
In addition, silverfish reset experience.
They should drop a new item as well as endermites something that would make sense and be useful at the same time
Illogical. Silver and iron are entirely different materials.

I mean they are meant to be a pest, but I would love to see them have a drop, maybe silver dust to make a new potion that allows the player to see infested stones, giving a short logic loop of use. Kill Silverfish, brew a potion of "Infested Sight", safely mine out blocks around or silk touch infested blocks for later shenanigans. 

Endermites should drop dust that when brewed creates a "Potion of Ender", giving the player the teleport ability of Endermen when range weapons almost hit or sufficient damage (2 hearts) is dealt during the duration.
I think is an interesting mechanic, maybe even a way to represent the minerals they could have absorved from eating and digging throught stone

I like this alot.

As a counter-point to it being illogical:
Perhaps the name silverfish refers to the grey colour which was mistaken for the colour of any grey metal that it might've actually been. I doubt the first people to discover the silverfish spent a long time determining the metal type. They'd have been too busy running from the swarm. By the time the metal was identified the name already stuck.

Also a non-lore reasoning:
sil·ver
/ˈsilvər/
noun
a shiny gray-white color or appearance like that of silver.

 

Either way the silverfish dropping iron still makes a lot of sense despite the initial, literal interpretation of the name.

I think Hedgehogs would be a great addition to Minecraft! Here are some of my suggestions.

If you spook a hedgehog, they immediately strike you with spikes decreasing your health by two hearts, and run away.

But you can tame hedgehogs like any other mob, but it will be just as tricky as taming an ocelot due to their spikes hurting you in the process.

Once you have tamed a hedgehog, you can use shears to collect its spikes without them attacking you, and they won’t run away as much. But of course, you can still do without them being tamed, but your health is at risk unless you use a potion first.

After you’ve collected your spikes, you can use their poison in potions. And you can use them as an arrow against unfriendly mobs.

If I think of any more ideas, I’ll add them here. Let me know what y’all think! Thank you!
Honestly, I don’t think the hedgehog would be suited for vanilla Minecraft. Besides, you can probably just get hedgehogs in a mod.

The variety of mob variants would at the very least serve to make the world feel a little more organic, especially if two animals of different variants breeding would only produce an offspring with one of the two parent variations, making a farm of all the cosmetic variants a neat collectible goal. Especially if certain animal variants only occur under specific conditions, such as albinos being exclusive to bred animals, appearing at a low chance or muddy pigs requiring mud blocks in the vicinity of a pig coming into existence (natural spawn, spawn egg or breeding).
Fun fact: they spawn under jagged peaks and frozen peaks
They can be often found under mountain biomes, no map needed.

Any item.

That is a great idea... but there is one jarring issue. To place a block you need to right click, and to drink a potion you need to right click. That means that it'll be all too easy to accidently place the potion while trying to drink it, which would cause a lot of issues especially in pvp/life or death situations.

Maybe to place it you would specifically have to shift right-click (right click while sneaking).
